intro: Neopectinaria stayneri, commonly known as the Stayner's pectinaria, is a species of flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in coastal areas or near freshwater habitats. Its botanical features make it an attractive ornamental plant, though it is less commonly cultivated than other members of its family.
